stimulusHtml: How much sand will the tide remove from the beach during this 6-hour period? Indicate units of measure.

features.html:
The tide removes sand from Sandy Point Beach at a rate modeled by the function R, given by  R( t )=2+5sin( 4πt 25 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@46AC@ .

A pumping station adds sand to the beach at a rate modeled by the function S, given by  S( t )= 15t 1+3t MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40A7@ .

Both R(t) and S(t) have units of cubic yards per hour and t is measured in hours for 0≤t≤6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF1@ . At time t = 0, the beach contains 2500 cubic yards of sand.
